description: From Latin splēnicus, from Ancient Greek σπληνικός (splēnikós, “of the spleen”).

adjectives.description: splenic (comparative more splenic, superlative most splenic)

entries.meaning: Of, related to, or located near the spleen.
examples: The Liuer by the splenike branch, transferreth them to the Serjeant of the scullery the Splene.
